organization.description:
Weather, temperature, carbon, water, soil and all other kinds of climate related open data.  Including (but not limited to) data about:

 * the atmosphere
 * the weather
 * air quality
 * temperature
 * the ocean
 * rivers
 * water levels
 * water quality
 * carbon emissions
 * pollution
 * soil erosion
 * biodiversity

For background information see [blog on article on IPCC data](http://blog.okfn.org/2007/11/20/the-ipcc-data-distribution-centre-environmental-data-licensing/), [the wiki](http://wiki.okfn.org/OpenEnvironmentalData), and [this other blog article](http://blog.okfn.org/2009/12/05/climate-change-climate-sceptics-and-open-data/). If you would like to help update or maintain this group, please [get in touch](http://okfn.org/contact)!

The climate data group is supported by the [Open Knowledge Foundation](http://www.okfn.org), [Clear Climate Code](http://clearclimatecode.org/) and the scientists at [Real Climate](http://www.realclimate.org/).

### Existing Lists of Climate Datasets to Migrate Here

 * <http://www.realclimate.org/index.php/data-sources/>
 * <http://ergodd.zoo.ox.ac.uk/eden/index.php?p=10>
 * <http://wiki.okfn.org/OpenEnvironmentalData/DatabaseOfEmissionsData>
 * <http://wiki.okfn.org/OpenEnvironmentalData>
organization.title: Climate Data
organization.name: climatedata

name: ncar-eol
notes:
### About

From [Laboratory profile](http://www.eol.ucar.edu/help/laboratory-information):

> NCAR's Earth Observing Laboratory develops and deploys NSF Lower Atmospheric Observing Facilities (LAOF) and provides field project support and data services needed to advance scientific understanding of the earth system.

> EOL employs 175 staff responsible for important advances in scientific and engineering strides in the atmospheric research community. Our teams of scientists, engineers, software engineers and technicians take research further afield to gain a more complete understanding of our earth atmospheric phenomena.

### Access/re-use

Data is available through [CODIAC](http://data.eol.ucar.edu/codiac/) and the [Research Data and Deployment Archive](http://www.eol.ucar.edu/eol_data.html).

Terms of re-use are not entirely clear. Presumed to be open, as recent [EOL Data Policy](http://www.eol.ucar.edu/data/eol-data-policy) page says:

> EOL encourages complete, open access to all NSF-sponsored data sets.

However, another [terms of use](http://www.ucar.edu/legal/terms_of_use.shtml) page says:

> The user is granted the right to use this Site for non-commercial, non-profit  research, or educational purposes only, without any fee or cost.
title: National Center for Atmospheric Research (NCAR) - Earth Observing Laboratory
